dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.enterprise.risk.sec.inc.SecurityIncidentAttackMethod
dataStructure.description:
Describes the attack used that caused the incident. The attack method is the method used by the Threat Actor to impact the IT service.

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: SecurityIncidentAttackMethod

child.name: description
child.description:
Free text field descriping the attack method

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: description

child.name: rootCause
child.description:
Description of the root cause of the attack

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: rootCause

child.name: attackVector
child.description:
Attack method chosen from the following enumerated list: Exploited New Vulnerability Exploited Known Vulnerability Self Propagating Malicious Logic Insider Purposeful Insider Accidental Distributed Network Activity Non Distributed Network Activity Network Scan System Scan Compromise Through Another System Reconnaissance Unknown/NA Other (See Comment)

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is mandatory

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: attackVector

child.name: securityIncident
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association SecurityIncidentAttackedUsing

This association end is optional
child.label: securityIncident
